content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can do it in Julia using DataFrames.jl package:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Extract year and month from dt and concatenate them into yyyymm format
    df[:ym] = map((dt)->format(DateTime(dt), "Y") * string(month(DateTime(dt))), df[:dt]) |> collect
end
```
This function maps over the column `dt` in DataFrame `df`, extracts year and month from each date, concatenates them into a string of format “yyyymm”, and assigns it to a new column `ym`. 

Please make sure you have installed the necessary package by typing `using DataFrames.jl` in your Julia console before running this function.
